justification: The article notes that activity in the ventromedial prefrontal cortex "correlates with the overall subjective value of an option" (Clithero & Rangel, 2014), indicating that vmPFC activation is used to index or measure the construct of subjective value.

It states that "The dorsal anterior cingulate cortex (dACC)... seems to calculate the return-on-investment of the effort required by a task," showing that dACC activation is treated as a neural measure of perceived effort costs.

The paper explains that drift diffusion models "capture choice and response time patterns with remarkable accuracy" for value-based decisions (Ratcliff & Frank, 2012), implying that DDM parameters are used to quantify the underlying evidence-accumulation construct.

The authors report that "Control networks such as lateral prefrontal cortex contribute to self-control by influencing the weights given to different attributes" (Hare, Malmaud, & Rangel, 2011), using LPFC activation as an indicator of self-control processes.
